sprint_goal: Establish Foundational Framework, Core Auth & Secure Sandbox POC
epic_coverage: Application Framework, User Authentication, User-Extensible Custom Modes (Sandbox POC)
key_deliverables: Initialized NestJS Backend, DB Connection & Migrations, Global Auth Guard (JWT), User Data Schemas, Core APIs (Variables, History), Account Deletion Service, Secure Lambda Sandbox POC
demo_objectives: Demonstrate successful startup with DB connection and logging. Show protected vs. public endpoints. Demo API calls for creating/reading user variables. Showcase the secure Lambda executing a simple formula.
success_criteria: All foundational tasks complete. Auth guard successfully protects endpoints. Core user data APIs are functional and tested. `isolated-vm` Lambda is successfully deployed and tested.
risk_factors: Complexity of setting up `isolated-vm` in AWS Lambda (RISK-001). Correct implementation of the JWT validation and auth guard (RISK-002).
mitigation_strategies: Allocate significant buffer time for Lambda setup. Conduct mandatory security review of auth code.
burndown_target: Linear burndown, aiming for 70% completion by day 7.

sprint_name: Sprint 2: Custom Modes, Sync, and Compliance
sprint_goal: Custom Mode APIs, Offline Sync & Compliance Features
epic_coverage: User-Extensible Custom Modes (API), User Authentication (Compliance), Offline Sync
key_deliverables: Full CRUD and Execute API for Custom Modes, GDPR Data Export functionality, Backend support for Offline Data Synchronization with conflict resolution, Full API Documentation (OpenAPI).
demo_objectives: Demonstrate creating, retrieving, updating, and deleting a custom mode via API. Show execution of a custom mode. Trigger a GDPR data export and show the email notification. Demonstrate 'last-write-wins' conflict resolution.
success_criteria: All custom mode APIs are fully functional and tested. GDPR export process works end-to-end. Offline sync conflict resolution logic is validated.
risk_factors: Complexity of offline sync conflict resolution logic (RISK-003). Asynchronous nature of GDPR export process involving multiple AWS services.
mitigation_strategies: Extensive E2E testing for conflict scenarios. Robust error handling and DLQ for the GDPR export Lambda. Lower capacity utilization provides buffer for complexity.
external_dependencies: AWS SQS, S3, SES, Lambda infrastructure must be provisioned.
integration_windows: Integration testing of API Gateway -> Lambda for custom mode execution on day 5-6.
burndown_target: Linear burndown with 60% completion by day 6.
